text:
This is great, rendering CTAs has been a pain up until now. It would also be good to get this with Advanced Menus as well (under Settings > Website > Menus) basically replicating the HubL menu function.

Right now I'm using a hublDataTemplate to fetch that information but I can't dinamically change the menu ID.

Hello there, I've deployed a module built in react on my HubSpot account. I can see it in my content editor when I search it and use it from there but I don't see it in my design manager. I've also uploaded the hello-world-theme from the cms-react github repository and I face the same issue there. I can see the theme folder but I don't see any module there in my design manager. I think this is an expected behavior since react modules don't consist the typical html-css-js structure. The issue is: I'm trying to create a blog-post template from scratch and there I want to add this module. The syntax for this code is: {% module 'blog_comments' path='@HubSpot/blog_comments', label="Blog comments" %}. But I can't provide any path here since the module isn't visible in the design manager. Is there any way to solve this issue?
I don't get any errors when I try to run locally. <@UAYBXDG4U> <@UCY83QS6Q> can you please help me figure out why I'm getting this error?
Could you send me what your hublDataTemplate looks like in DM?

> I'm trying to create a blog-post template from scratch and there I want to add this module
Just checking I am understanding correctly, you want to hardcode a `{% module %}` reference to your React module in your HubL template?
Yes. I want to add my react module here to create a blog-post template

Gotcha, so you are able to reference React modules via the module tag

you can do so via

`{% module "module_name" path="@projects/<project_name>/<project_component_directory>/components/modules/<ReactModuleName>" %}`
Will take a look at Menus for next component

Hi guys,

One piece of feedback, I still get very unhelpful error messages during build, I got this now (`The build failed due to an internal error with id `9db40e93-8a2f-4f3e-90e7-265f5e31ad5d`. Try uploading it again. If the problem persists, contact HubSpot support with the error id.`), see screenshot attached. I only changed one small part of a module for this to happen, dev server works fine, very frustrating. Un-descriptive build errors are a still a big issue imo, been using React modules for 6+ months now and still there haven't been many advances on this front. I tried re-uploading 3 times and same thing happened.

I don't even get an error in the log trail, I get a "Done" message.
What's worse in my case is, I have sandbox development account and the build works fine there without any changes, but doesn't in the production account.

Any fix yet for the CLI issues with the `hs secrets` commands? I've been having to make a seperate apiKeys.ts file for the past 2 months already since this isn't operational
```[ERROR] The secrets could not be listed```
I just updated my platform version in hsproject.json and my upload still fails with an error saying that the platform version is missing
was there somewhere else that i needed to make the change?
<@U04DLJH3W94> how would I use the  `RichText` component with  `props.fieldValues` ?
make sure to remove the old cli from the package.json
and update yours to the latest version
I’ll give it a try
^ for future reference. This was solved by moving `@HubSpot/cli` outside of dependencies
Thank you. I felt it was a project structure issue but didn't know exactly how to solve this

Thanks Marcus, since I'm working on a form now I think the Form component would also be helpful! All the standard parts of HubSpot which make up part of a website really: ctas, forms, meetings, menus, etc.
Releasing Forms ASAP! Early this week
What specific command are you having an issue with?

<@UDHT6N5SM> `<RichText />` only works via providing a fieldPath

If you'd like to work with field values directly, you may use React's <https://react.dev/reference/react-dom/components/common#dangerously-setting-the-inner-html|dangerouslySetInnerHTML>
worked! Thanks <@U05CAJG8D98>

ok, I'll give this a try in a bit. It's honestly a little confusing at the moment how to actually use `<Richtext/>` in the end. I would want to access it inside of an `island` probably right? is this an extension of how `fields.jsx` works or is this a new concept?
everything, the add, list, remove.. nothing is working, before the latest CLI update it was just some random error, now its saying that the "app doesn't have permissions to access secrets"
Hi Arrigo, apologies for this issue. This should be fixed in your portal now. Mind rebuilding your project and letting me know if the error still persists?
Will try in a few moments.
<@U04DLJH3W94> I get this error when trying to use the Cta component, does it require CMS Pro and above? Would be weird since CTAs are available to Starter as well.
I'm using a sandbox account, that might be why it breaks though.

I ran into the same a few days ago, creating a new crm card. However, I’ve also had it work in the past. One thought/potential possibility that crossed my mind: the account I was working in most recently that had the problem had access to crm cards, but did not have cms hub e to allow for access to the core serverless functions.

Is it possible that there’s some incongruence there  causing an issue. that isn’t accounted for on the backend of the CLI?
